NameFlagsCard.TypeDescription & Constraints
Extension 0..*ExtensionExtension
extension:value 0..1ExtensionBAL MSS
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"value"
value[x] 0..1stringValue of extension
extension:type 0..1ExtensionExtension
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"type"
value[x] 0..1CodeableConceptValue of extension
Binding: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/JDV_J139-TypeBAL-RASS/FHIR/JDV-J139-TypeBAL-RASS (required): Type de boîte aux lettre MSS

coding
system 0..1uriIdentity of the terminology system
Fixed Value: https://mos.esante.gouv.fr/NOS/TRE_R257-TypeBAL/FHIR/TRE-R257-TypeBAL
extension:description 0..1ExtensionExtension
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"description"
value[x] 0..1stringDescription fonctionnelle de la boîte aux lettres
extension:responsible 0..1ExtensionExtension
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"responsible"
value[x] 0..1stringTexte libre donnant les coordonnées de la (ou des) personne(s) responsable(s) au niveau opérationnel de la boîte aux lettres. Non renseigné pour les types de boîte aux lettres "PER".
extension:service 0..1ExtensionExtension
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"service"
value[x] 0..1stringNom et description du service de rattachement de l’utilisateur de la boîte aux lettres dans l’organisation.
extension:phone 0..1ExtensionExtension
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"phone"
value[x] 0..1stringCoordonnées téléphoniques spécifiques à l’usage de la boîte aux lettres MSSanté
extension:digitization 0..1ExtensionExtension
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"digitization"
value[x] 0..1booleanIndicateur d’acceptation de la dématérialisation (ou « Zéro papier »
extension:publication 0..1ExtensionExtension
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"publication"
value[x] 0..1booleanndicateur liste rouge
extension:date 0..*ExtensionExtension
extension 0..0
url 1..1uri"date"
value[x] 0..1MetaValue of extension
source 0..1uriIdentifies where the resource comes from
Fixed Value: https://annuaire.sante.fr
profile 0..*canonical(StructureDefinition)Profiles this resource claims to conform to
Fixed Value: https://apifhir.annuaire.sante.fr/exposed/structuredefinition/mailboxMSS
url 1..1uri"http://interop.esante.gouv.fr/ig/fhir/as03/StructureDefinition/MailboxMSS"
value[x] 0..0

Documentation for this format

name: MailboxMSS
description: Informations descriptives des boîtes aux lettres du service de messagerie sécurisée de santé (MSSanté) rattachées aux professionnels et aux structures.

element.definition: Informations descriptives des boîtes aux lettres du service de messagerie sécurisée de santé (MSSanté) rattachées aux professionnels et aux structures.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html) for a list).

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: Code defined by a terminology system
element.definition: A reference to a code defined by a terminology system.
element.comment: Codes may be defined very casually in enumerations, or code lists, up to very formal definitions such as SNOMED CT - see the HL7 v3 Core Principles for more information.  Ordering of codings is undefined and SHALL NOT be used to infer meaning. Generally, at most only one of the coding values will be labeled as UserSelected = true.
element.requirements: Allows for alternative encodings within a code system, and translations to other code systems.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and manageable, there is a strict set of governance  applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: The identification of the code system that defines the meaning of the symbol in the code.
element.comment: The URI may be an OID (urn:oid:...) or a UUID (urn:uuid:...).  OIDs and UUIDs SHALL be references to the HL7 OID registry. Otherwise, the URI should come from HL7's list of FHIR defined special URIs or it should reference to some definition that establishes the system clearly and unambiguously.
element.requirements: Need to be unambiguous about the source of the definition of the symbol.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Version of the system - if relevant
element.definition: The version of the code system which was used when choosing this code. Note that a well-maintained code system does not need the version reported, because the meaning of codes is consistent across versions. However this cannot consistently be assured, and when the meaning is not guaranteed to be consistent, the version SHOULD be exchanged.
element.comment: Where the terminology does not clearly define what string should be used to identify code system versions, the recommendation is to use the date (expressed in FHIR date format) on which that version was officially published as the version date.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Symbol in syntax defined by the system
element.definition: A symbol in syntax defined by the system. The symbol may be a predefined code or an expression in a syntax defined by the coding system (e.g. post-coordination).
element.requirements: Need to refer to a particular code in the system.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: A representation of the meaning of the code in the system, following the rules of the system.
element.requirements: Need to be able to carry a human-readable meaning of the code for readers that do not know  the system.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: C*E.2 - but note this is not well followed

element.short: If this coding was chosen directly by the user
element.definition: Indicates that this coding was chosen by a user directly - e.g. off a pick list of available items (codes or displays).
element.comment: Amongst a set of alternatives, a directly chosen code is the most appropriate starting point for new translations. There is some ambiguity about what exactly 'directly chosen' implies, and trading partner agreement may be needed to clarify the use of this element and its consequences more completely.
element.requirements: This has been identified as a clinical safety criterium - that this exact system/code pair was chosen explicitly, rather than inferred by the system based on some rules or language processing.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: fhir:Coding.userSelected fhir:mapsTo dt:CDCoding.codingRationale. fhir:Coding.userSelected fhir:hasMap fhir:Coding.userSelected.map. fhir:Coding.userSelected.map a fhir:Map;   fhir:target dt:CDCoding.codingRationale. fhir:Coding.userSelected\#true a [     fhir:source "true";     fhir:target dt:CDCoding.codingRationale\#O   ]

element.short: Plain text representation of the concept
element.definition: A human language representation of the concept as seen/selected/uttered by the user who entered the data and/or which represents the intended meaning of the user.
element.comment: Very often the text is the same as a displayName of one of the codings.
element.requirements: The codes from the terminologies do not always capture the correct meaning with all the nuances of the human using them, or sometimes there is no appropriate code at all. In these cases, the text is used to capture the full meaning of the source.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

mapping.map: C*E.9. But note many systems use C*E.2 for this

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: The version specific identifier, as it appears in the version portion of the URL. This value changes when the resource is created, updated, or deleted.
element.comment: The server assigns this value, and ignores what the client specifies, except in the case that the server is imposing version integrity on updates/deletes.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: When the resource version last changed
element.definition: When the resource last changed - e.g. when the version changed.
element.comment: This value is always populated except when the resource is first being created. The server / resource manager sets this value; what a client provides is irrelevant. This is equivalent to the HTTP Last-Modified and SHOULD have the same value on a [read](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/http.html#read) interaction.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Identifies where the resource comes from
element.definition: A uri that identifies the source system of the resource. This provides a minimal amount of [Provenance](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/provenance.html#) information that can be used to track or differentiate the source of information in the resource. The source may identify another FHIR server, document, message, database, etc.
element.comment:
In the provenance resource, this corresponds to Provenance.entity.what[x]. The exact use of the source (and the implied Provenance.entity.role) is left to implementer discretion. Only one nominated source is allowed; for additional provenance details, a full Provenance resource should be used. 

This element can be used to indicate where the current master source of a resource that has a canonical URL if the resource is no longer hosted at the canonical URL.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Profiles this resource claims to conform to
element.definition: A list of profiles (references to [StructureDefinition](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/structuredefinition.html#) resources) that this resource claims to conform to. The URL is a reference to [StructureDefinition.url](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/structuredefinition-definitions.html#StructureDefinition.url).
element.comment: It is up to the server and/or other infrastructure of policy to determine whether/how these claims are verified and/or updated over time.  The list of profile URLs is a set.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.short: Security Labels applied to this resource
element.definition: Security labels applied to this resource. These tags connect specific resources to the overall security policy and infrastructure.
element.comment: The security labels can be updated without changing the stated version of the resource. The list of security labels is a set. Uniqueness is based the system/code, and version and display are ignored.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Security Labels from the Healthcare Privacy and Security Classification System.

element.definition: Tags applied to this resource. Tags are intended to be used to identify and relate resources to process and workflow, and applications are not required to consider the tags when interpreting the meaning of a resource.
element.comment: The tags can be updated without changing the stated version of the resource. The list of tags is a set. Uniqueness is based the system/code, and version and display are ignored.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

binding.description: Codes that represent various types of tags, commonly workflow-related; e.g. "Needs review by Dr. Jones".

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](http://hl7.org/fhir/R4/extensibility.html) for a list).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Informations descriptives des boîtes aux lettres du service de messagerie sécurisée de santé (MSSanté) rattachées aux professionnels et aux structures.

binding.description: Type de  boîte aux lettre MSS

element.short: Description fonctionnelle de la boîte aux lettres
Texte libre donnant les coordonnées de la (ou des) personne(s) responsable(s) au niveau opérationnel de la boîte aux lettres. Non renseigné pour les types de boîte aux lettres "PER".
Nom et description du service de rattachement de l’utilisateur de la boîte aux lettres dans l’organisation.
Coordonnées téléphoniques spécifiques à l’usage de la boîte aux lettres MSSanté
Indicateur d’acceptation de la dématérialisation (ou « Zéro papier »
element.comment:
- O : Dématérialisation acceptée 
- N : Dématérialisation refusée

O: Boîte aux lettres en liste rouge;
N: La boîte aux lettres peut être publiée
